alert.note: Alert for Hockley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 30 at 6:28PM CDT until June 30 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Hockley and Terry Counties. * WHEN...Until 730 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 628 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated continuing moderate to heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible over the area. This additional rain will result in the continuation of minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Levelland, Sundown, Locketville, Smyer and Opdyke West.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
